Google Trust Signals Checklist

Follow this checklist to strengthen Google trust signals for your local SEO. Each item is actionable — check it off as you complete it.

Authoritative Local Backlinks

  • Sponsor local schools, sports teams, or community events (example: logo on a team jersey or event page link)

  • Join your local Chamber of Commerce and get a website listing
  • Earn links from local newspapers, blogs, or community sites
  • Partner with reputable local businesses for cross-promotion
  • Ensure your website link is included naturally in all mentions

NAP & Citations

  • Name, Address, Phone match exactly across GBP and website
  • NAP visible on homepage, contact page, and footer
  • Listed on trusted directories (Yelp, BBB, Foursquare, etc.)
  • Service-area citations for every city you serve
  • No duplicate, outdated, or inconsistent listings

Reviews & Engagement

  • Collect reviews from real customers on a consistent basis
  • Respond to every review within 24–48 hours
  • Encourage photo or video reviews when possible
  • Answer all Google Business Profile Q&A
  • Post GBP updates weekly (offers, news, photos, events)

Website & Technical Trust

  • Website uses HTTPS (SSL) and loads securely
  • Homepage H1 matches GBP primary category wording
  • Main services clearly listed on homepage (H2 sections)
  • Service and location pages match GBP services & areas
  • LocalBusiness schema implemented on homepage
  • Contact page includes NAP and embedded Google Map

Social & Online Presence

  • Social profiles created and linked to website & GBP
  • Consistent posting and engagement on social platforms
  • Links from relevant industry or trade associations
